system.commands.history.help.text:
📂 History Commands:
  history        Show this help
  history -c     Clear history
  ↑ ↓           Navigate history

  File: ~/.rss/rush.history
system.commands.history.usage.text: 📂 Use ↑↓ arrows to navigate, 'history -c' to clear
system.commands.log_level.changed_persis: ✅ Log level changed to: {0} ({1}) - Saved persistently
system.commands.log_level.changed_succes: ✅ Log level changed to: {0} ({1}) - Saved persistently
system.commands.log_level.help.text:
Available log levels:
  1 = ERROR   (Only critical errors)
  2 = WARN    (Warnings and errors)
  3 = INFO    (General information) [DEFAULT]
  4 = DEBUG   (Debug information)
  5 = TRACE   (Very detailed tracing)

Usage:
  log-level           Show current level
  log-level 3         Set to INFO level
  log-level DEBUG     Set to DEBUG level
  log-level -h        Show this help
system.commands.log_level.help_text.text:
Available log levels:
  1 = ERROR   (Only critical errors)
  2 = WARN    (Warnings and errors)
  3 = INFO    (General information) [DEFAULT]
  4 = DEBUG   (Debug information)
  5 = TRACE   (Very detailed tracing)

Usage:
  log-level           Show current level
  log-level 3         Set to INFO level
  log-level DEBUG     Set to DEBUG level
  log-level -h        Show this help

system.commands.theme.help.cursor_option:
🎛️ Cursor Options:
• output_cursor: BLOCK, PIPE, UNDERSCORE
• output_color: Any supported color (White, Green, etc.)
system.commands.theme.help.header.text: 🎨 TOML-Theme Commands (Live Update - Loaded from rush.toml!):
🔄 Changes are applied immediately (no restart needed)
system.commands.theme.help.live_loaded.t: ✨ All themes are loaded LIVE from [theme.*] sections in rush.toml!
system.commands.theme.help.preview_theme: theme preview <name> Preview theme colors + cursor config ✅ NEW!
📂 Add [theme.my_theme] sections to rush.toml:

[theme.my_theme]
input_text = "White"
input_bg = "Black"
cursor = "Green"
output_text = "Gray"
output_bg = "Black"
prompt_text = ">> "
prompt_color = "Cyan"
output_cursor = "BLOCK"
output_color = "LightGreen"
